snippet: A cellphone video showing a white officer shoving a black teenage girl to the ground in McKinney, Tex., and waving his gun at other partygoers has set off another debate over race and police tactics.
abstract: Cellphone video of confrontation between police and teenagers at pool party in McKinney, Tex, which features jarring image of police Officer David Eric Casebolt restraining African-American girl Dajerria Becton face-down on ground, has sparked protests by area residents, internal investigation by police department and suspension of Officer Casebolt.

byline.original: By CAROL COLE-FROWE and RICHARD FAUSSET
byline.contributor: Carol Cole-Frowe reported from McKinney, and Richard Fausset from Atlanta.

lead_paragraph: A cellphone video showing a white officer shoving a black teenage girl to the ground in McKinney, Tex., and waving his gun at other partygoers has set off another debate over race and police tactics.

headline.main: Jarring Image of Police’s Use of Force at Texas Pool Party
headline.print_headline: A Party at a Pool, a Jarring Image of Police Force
